member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.PrimaryXAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for PrimaryXAxis.
member.remarks: This is a horizontal axis that contains options to configure axis and it is the primary x axis for all the series in series array. To override x axis for particular series, create an axis object by providing unique name by using name property and add it to axes array. Then, assign the name to the series’s xAxisName property to link both axis and series.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value for PrimaryYAxis.
member.remarks: This is a vertical axis that contains options to configure axis. This is the primary y axis for all the series in series array. To override y axis for particular series, create an axis object by providing unique name by using name property and add it to axes array. Then, assign the name to the series’s yAxisName property to link both axis and series.

member.remarks: Options for customizing the title and subtitle of Chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.EnableCanvasRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for EnableCanvasRendering.
member.remarks: Controls whether Chart has to be rendered as Canvas or SVG. Canvas rendering supports all functionalities in SVG rendering except 3D Charts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.Enable3D
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for Enable3D.
member.remarks: Controls whether 3D view has to be enabled or not. 3D view is supported only for column, bar. Stacking column, stacking bar, pie and doughnut series types.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.EnableRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for EnableRotation.
member.remarks: Controls whether 3D view has to be rotated on dragging. This property is applicable only for 3D view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.PerspectiveAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for PerspectiveAngle.
member.remarks: Perspective angle of the 3D view. Chart appears closer when perspective angle is decreased, and distant when perspective angle is increased. This property is applicable only when 3D view is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for Rotation.
member.remarks: Rotation angle of the 3D view. This property is applicable only when 3D view is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.Tilt
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for Tilt.
member.remarks: Slope angle of 3D Chart. This property is applicable only when 3D view is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.WallSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for WallSize.
member.remarks: Width of the wall used in 3D Chart. Wall is present only in Cartesian type 3D series and not in 3D pie or Doughnut series. This property is applicable only when 3D view is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for Depth.
member.remarks: Depth of the 3D Chart from front view of series to background wall. This property is applicable only for 3D view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.SideBySideSeriesPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for SideBySideSeriesPlacement.
member.remarks: Controls whether data points has to be displayed side by side or along the depth of the axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.ChartProperties.Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for Locale.
member.remarks: Name of the culture based on which chart should be localized. Number and date time values are localized with respect to the culture name. String type properties like title text are not localized automatically. Provide localized text as value to string type properties.

member.summary: Configures the data source that is to be bound with diagram

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.DiagramPropertiesBuilder.HistoryManager(System.Action{Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.HistoryManagerBuilder})
member.summary: Customizes the undo redo functionality

example.code:
<script>
                    //Method to handle the custom action
                    function customUndoRedo(args) {
                    var diagram = $("#diagram").ejDiagram("instance");
                    var node = args.object;
                    var currentState = node.empInfo;
                    //Resets the state
                    node.empInfo = args.prevState;
                    //Saves the previous state
                    args.prevState = currentState;
                } 
             </script>
            @(Html.EJ().Diagram("Diagram1")
                    .Width("100%").
                        Height("725px").Width("800px").HistoryManager(h => h.Undo("").Redo(""));            
            )

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Connector.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip that should be shown when the mouse hovers over connector

example.code: DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();             Connector connector = new Connector();             connector.Name = "connector1";             connector.SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint(100, 100);             connector.TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint(200, 200);             connector.VerticalAlign = VerticalAlignment.Top;             connector.Segments.Add(new Segment() { Type = Segments.Straight });             Tooltip tooltip = new Tooltip();             tooltip.TemplateId = "mouseovertooltip";             tooltip.Alignment.Horizontal = HorizontalAlignment.Center;             tooltip.Alignment.Vertical = VerticalAlignment.Bottom;             connector.Constraints = ConnectorConstraints.InheritTooltip;             connector.Tooltip = tooltip;             Model.Connectors.Add(connector);             ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Connector.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the styles of shapes

example.code:
<style>
                    .hoverConnector:hover {
                        stroke:blue
                    }
                </style>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Connector connector1 = new Connector();
                        connector1.Name = "connector1";
                        connector1.SourcePoint = new DiagramPoint(100, 100);
                        connector1.TargetPoint = new DiagramPoint(200, 200);
                        connector1.CssClass = "hoverConnector";
                        Model.Connectors.Add(connector1);
                        ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: T:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.NameSpaceDoc
member.summary: In this namespace, we define the diagram class files nodes,connectors,port,group. Nodes are graphical objects used to visually represent the geometrical information, process flow, internal business procedure, entity, or any other kind of data. Connectors are objects used to create link between two points, nodes or ports to represent the relationships between them. Essential Diagram for JS provides support to define custom ports for making connections. Label is a block of text that can be displayed over a node or connector. Label is used to textually represent an object with a string that can be edited at run time. Group is used to cluster multiple nodes and connectors into a single element. It acts like a container for its children (nodes, groups, and connectors). Every change made to the group also affects the children. Child elements can be edited individually.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Group

member.name: F:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.NativeNode._mScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale type of the svg/html templates. Applicable, if the type of the node is html or native.

example.code: <script id="svgTemplate" type="text/x-jsrender"> <svg version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="70px" height="30px"> <g visibility="visible"> <image width="70px" height="35px" opacity="1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="{{:addInfo.source}}"></image> <text x="25" y="20" font-size="11" style="height:30px"> <tspan>{{:name}}</tspan> </text> </g> </svg> </script> NativeNode node = new NativeNode() { Name = "bpmn", TemplateId = "svgTemplate", Scale = ScaleConstraints.Stretch };

member.name: F:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.NativeNode._mContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the svg/image content inside a node. Applicable, if the type of the nodeis image.

example.code: <script id="svgTemplate" type="text/x-jsrender"> <svg version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="70px" height="30px"> <g visibility="visible"> <image width="70px" height="35px" opacity="1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="{{:addInfo.source}}"></image> <text x="25" y="20" font-size="11" style="height:30px"> <tspan>{{:name}}</tspan> </text> </g> </svg> </script> NativeNode node = new NativeNode() { Name = "bpmn", TemplateId = "svgTemplate", ContentAlignment = ContentAlignment.XMaxYMax };

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Command.Gesture
member.summary: Gets or sets a combination of keys and key modifiers, on recognition of which the command will be executed

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Command.CanExecute
member.summary: Gets or sets a method that defines whether the command is executable at the moment or not

example.code:
<script>
                   
                    function execute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        diagram.copy();
                        diagram.paste();
                    }
                </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.CommandManager = new CommandManager();
                        Command command = new Command();
                        command.Execute = "execute";
                        Model.CommandManager.Commands.Add("clone", command);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Command.Execute
member.summary: Gets or sets method that defines the action to be done when the specified key gesture is recognized

example.code:
<script>
                    function canExecute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        return diagram.model.selectedItems.children.length;
                    } 
                </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.CommandManager = new CommandManager();
                        Command command = new Command();
                        
                        command.CanExecute = "canExecute"; 
                        Model.CommandManager.Commands.Add("clone", command);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.Command.Parameter
member.summary: Gets or sets any additional parameters that are required at runtime

example.code:
<script>
                    function execute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        return diagram.model.selectedItems.children.length;
                    } 
                </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.CommandManager = new CommandManager();
                        Command command = new Command();
                        command.Parameter = "node";
                        command.Execute = "execute"; 
                        Model.CommandManager.Commands.Add("clone", command);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Diagram.CommandManager.Commands
member.summary: Gets or sets object that maps a set of command names with the corresponding command objects

example.code:
<script>
                    function canExecute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        return diagram.model.selectedItems.children.length;
                    }
                    function execute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        diagram.copy();
                        diagram.paste();
                    }
                </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.CommandManager = new CommandManager();
                        Command command = new Command();
                        command.Gesture = new Gesture();
                        command.Gesture.Key = Keys.C;
                        command.Gesture.KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Shift;
                        command.CanExecute = "canExecute";
                        command.Execute = "execute";
                        Model.CommandManager.Commands.Add("clone", command);

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.DiagramProperties.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom JSON data with node properties

example.code:
<script>
                 //Binds the custom properties with node properties and sets the styles
                 function nodeTemplate() {
                
                 }
                 </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.NodeTemplate = "nodeTemplate";
                        ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.DiagramProperties.ConnectorTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom JSON data with connector properties

example.code:
<script> 
                //Sets the default styles and binds custom data with connector
                    function connectorTemplate(diagram, connector) {
                        if(connector.sourceNode && connector.targetNode){
                            connector.linecolor = "green";
                        }
                    }
            </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.ConnectorTemplate = "connectorTemplate";
                        ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.DiagramProperties.DataSourceSettings
member.summary: Configures the data source that is to be bound with diagram

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.DiagramProperties.CommandManager
member.summary: Defines a set of custom commands and binds them with a set of desired key gestures.

example.code:
<script>
                    function canExecute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        return diagram.model.selectedItems.children.length;
                    }
                    function execute(args) {
                        var diagram = $("#DiagramContent").ejDiagram("instance");
                        diagram.copy();
                        diagram.paste();
                    }
                </script>
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.CommandManager = new CommandManager();
                        Command command = new Command();
                        command.Gesture = new Gesture();
                        command.Gesture.Key = Keys.C;
                        command.Gesture.KeyModifiers = KeyModifiers.Shift;
                        command.CanExecute = "canExecute";
                        command.Execute = "execute";
                        Model.CommandManager.Commands.Add("clone", command);
                        ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.DiagramProperties.HistoryManager
member.summary: Customizes the undo redo functionality

example.code:
<script> 
                    //Method to handle the custom action
                    function customUndoRedo(args) {
                    var diagram = $("#diagram").ejDiagram("instance");
                    var node = args.object;
                    var currentState = node.empInfo;
                    //Resets the state
                    node.empInfo = args.prevState;
                    //Saves the previous state
                    args.prevState = currentState;
                } 
             </script>
                       
                        DiagramProperties Model = new DiagramProperties();
                        Model.HistoryManager.Undo = "customUndoRedo";
                        Model.HistoryManager.Redo = "customUndoRedo";
                    
                        ViewData["diagramModel"] = Model;

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataVisualization.Models.Palette.TemplateId
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to bind on the palette header

example.code: <script id="svgTemplate" type="text/x-jsrender"> <svg version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="225px" height="32px" viewBox="0 -5 225 32"> <g visibility="visible"> <image width="20px" height="20px" opacity="1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="{{:addInfo.source}}"></image> <text x="40" y="18" font-size="14"> <tspan>{{:name}}</tspan> </text> </g> </svg> </script> SymbolPaletteProperties SymbolPalette = new SymbolPaletteProperties(); SymbolPalette.Palettes = new Collection(); Palette palette = new Palette("Connector") { Name = "Connector", TemplateId = "svgTemplate" }; palette.Items.Add(new Node() { Name = "node1", OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100, Height = 100, Width = 100 });

summary.para: Gets or sets the additional information about the palette.

member.summary: The Accordion control is an interface where lists of items can be collapsed or expanded. It has several collapsible panels where only one can be expanded at a time that is useful for dashboards where space is limited. Each Accordion control has a template for its header and its content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.MinHeight
member.summary: Sets the minimum height for the dialog widget.

member.summary: Sets the minimum width for the dialog widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Width
member.summary: Sets the width for the dialog widget. It accepts both string and integer values. For example, it can accepts values like “auto”, “100%”, “100px” as string type and “100”, “500” as integer type. The unit of integer type value is “px”.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.ZIndex
member.summary: Sets the z-index value for the Dialog widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.ShowOnInit
member.summary: The Dialog widget is being opened by default (i.e. on initialization) ,when its boolean value is set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.EnableAnimation
member.summary: Enable or disables animation when the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Closes the dialog widget on pressing the ESC key when it is set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.AllowDraggable
member.summary: Enables or disables draggable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.EnableModal
member.summary: Enable or disables modal dialog. The modal dialog acts like a child window that is displayed on top of the main window/screen and disables the main window interaction until it is closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.EnableResize
member.summary: Allows the dialog to be resized. The dialog cannot be resized less than the minimum height, width values and greater than the maximum height and width.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.IsResponsive
member.summary: Enable or disables responsive behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.EnableAutoResize
member.summary: Enable or disables responsive behavior.

member.summary: Shows or hides the dialog header.

member.summary: Shows or hides the dialog footer.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.BackgroundScroll
member.summary: Enable or Disable the Modal Dialog background scroller.

member.summary: Displays dialog content from right to left when set to true.By defaults it will be LTR.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.AllowKeyboardNavigation
member.summary: Enables or disables keyboard interaction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.ShowRoundedCorner
member.summary: Enables or disables the rounded corner for dialog window.

member.summary: Enables or disables the Dialog widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.CloseIconTooltip
member.summary: The tooltip text for the dialog close button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Height
member.summary: Sets the height for the dialog widget. It accepts both string and integer values. For example, it can accepts values like “auto”, “100%”, “100px” as string type and “100”, “500” as integer type. The unit of integer type value is “px”.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.MaxHeight
member.summary: Sets the maximum height for the dialog widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.MaxWidth
member.summary: Sets the maximum width for the dialog widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.ContentType
member.summary: The content type to load the dialog content at run time. The possible values are null, AJAX, iframe and image. When it is null (default value), the content inside dialog element will be displayed as content and when it is not null, the content will be loaded from the URL specified in the contentUrl property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.ContentUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL to load the dialog content (such as AJAX, image, and iframe). In order to load content from URL, you need to set contentType as ‘ajax’ or ‘iframe’ or ‘image’ with string argument.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Title
member.summary: The title text to be displayed in the dialog header. In order to set title, you need to set showHeader as true since the title will be displayed in the dialog header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.CssClass
member.summary: The root class for the Dialog widget to customize the existing theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Containment
member.summary: The selector for the container element. If the property is set, then dialog will append to the selected element and it is restricted to move only within the specified container element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.FaviconCSS
member.summary: The CSS class name to display the favicon in the dialog header. In order to display favicon, you need to set showHeader as true since the favicon will be displayed in the dialog header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Content
member.summary: The selector for the container element. If this property is set, the dialog will be displayed (positioned) based on its container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.FooterTemplateId
member.summary: This content to be displayed in dialog footer. In order to set content, before you need to set showFooter as true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Target
member.summary: The selector for the container element. If this property is set, the dialog will be displayed (positioned) based on its container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Locale
member.summary: Set the localization culture for Dialog Widget.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.AjaxSettings
member.summary: Specifies the ajaxSettings option to load the content to the dialog control.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DialogProperties.Animation

member.summary: Displays the Dialog widget at the given X and Y position.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DropDownListProperties.DelimiterChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the separator when the multiSelectMode with delimiter option or checkbox is enabled with the dropdown. When you enter the delimiter value, the texts after the delimiter are considered as a separate word or query. The delimiter string is a single character and must be a symbol. Mostly, the delimiter symbol is used as comma (,) or semi-colon (;) or any other special character.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.DropDownListProperties.VirtualScrollMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of records in the DropDownList, that is, when scrolling, an Ajax request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDownList, set the allowVirtualScrolling to true. You can set the itemsCount property that represents the number of items to be fetched from the server on every Ajax request.

member.summary: This property is used to sort the Items in the DropDownList. By default, it sorts the items in an ascending order.

member.summary: This property is used to sort the Items in the DropDownList. By default, it sorts the items in an ascending order.with boolean argument.

member.summary: This property is used to Dropdownlist popup and list generation load on demand.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.LoadOnDemand(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This property is used to Dropdownlist popup and list generation load on demand.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.AllowVirtualScrolling
member.summary: Loads the list data on demand via scrolling behavior to improve the application’s performance. There are two ways to load data which can be defined using “virtualScrollMode” property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.AllowVirtualScrolling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the list data on demand via scrolling behavior to improve the application’s performance. There are two ways to load data which can be defined using “virtualScrollMode” property.with boolean argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.MultiSelectMode(Syncfusion.JavaScript.MultiSelectModeTypes)
member.summary: With the help of this property, you can make a single or multi selection with the DropDownList and display the text in two modes, delimiter and visual mode. In delimiter mode, you can separate the items by using the delimiter character such as comma (,) or semi-colon (;) or any other special character. In the visual mode, the items are showcased like boxes with close icon in the textbox.with string argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.VirtualScrollMode(Syncfusion.JavaScript.VirtualScrollMode)
member.summary: The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of records in the DropDownList, that is, when scrolling, an Ajax request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically. To achieve this scenario with DropDownList, set the allowVirtualScrolling to true. You can set the itemsCount property that represents the number of items to be fetched from the server on every Ajax request.with string argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.FilterType(Syncfusion.JavaScript.SearchFilterType)
member.summary: When the enableFilterSearch property value is set to true, the values in the DropDownList shows the items starting with or containing the key word/letter typed in the Search textbox.with string argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.Locale(System.String)
member.summary: Different culture can be given locale property, Text present in Dropdownlist will be localized to respective culture.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.SortOrder(Syncfusion.JavaScript.SortOrder)
member.summary: When the enableSorting property value is set to true, this property helps to sort the items either in ascending or descending order.with string argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.Datasource(System.Action{Syncfusion.JavaScript.DataSourceBuilder})
member.summary: This property is used to serve data from the data services based on the query provided. To bind the data to the dropdown widget, the dataSource property is assigned with the instance of the ej.DataManager.with array argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.CascadeTo(System.String)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.DropDownListPropertiesBuilder.DelimiterChar(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the separator when the multiSelectMode with delimiter option or checkbox is enabled with the dropdown. When you enter the delimiter value, the texts after the delimiter are considered as a separate word or query. The delimiter string is a single character and must be a symbol. Mostly, the delimiter symbol is used as comma (,) or semi-colon (;) or any other special character.with string argument.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerExcelQueryCellInfo
member.summary: The OnServerExcelQueryCellInfo event is triggered every time a data is entered into a cell of the Excel sheet. So this event is triggered as many times as the data is entered into a cell written in the excel sheet. The properties corresponding to the XlsIO IRange Class are obtained from server-side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerExcelGroupCaptionInfo
member.summary: The OnServerExcelGroupCaptionFormating event is triggered every time a group caption row created on the excel sheet.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerExcelRowInfo
member.summary: The OnServerExcelRowInfo event is triggered every time a row is appended to the excel sheet. The properties corresponding to the XlsIO IRange Class are obtained server-side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerWordQueryCellInfo
member.summary: The OnServerWordQueryCellInfo event is triggered every time a cell data is written to the Word document. So this event is triggered as many times as that of the cell written to the word document. The properties corresponding to the DocIO.DLS.WTableCell Class is obtained server-side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerWordGroupCaptionInfo
member.summary: The OnServerWordGroupCaptionFormating event is triggered every time a group caption row created on the excel sheet.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerWordRowInfo
member.summary: The OnServerWordRowInfo event is triggered every time a row is inserted into the word document. The properties corresponding to the DocIO.DLS.WTableRow Class is obtained server-side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerPdfQueryCellInfo
member.summary: The OnServerPdfQueryCellInfo event is triggered every time data is written to the cell of the PdfGrid table. So this event is triggered as many times as that of the cell written to the grid table. The properties corresponding to the Pdf.Grid.PdfGridCell Class are obtained server-side.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerPdfGroupCaptionInfo
member.summary: The OnServerExcelGroupCaptionFormating event is triggered every time a group caption row created on the excel sheet.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.GridProperties.ServerPdfRowInfo
member.summary: The OnServerPdfRowInfo event is triggered every time a row is inserted to the PdfGrid. The properties corresponding to the Pdf.Grid.PdfGridRow Class are obtained server-side.

member.summary: Resizes the Rotator when the browser is resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.ShowThumbnail
member.summary: Turns on or off thumbnail support in the Rotator control. Thumbnail is used to navigate between slides. Thumbnail supports only single slide transition You must specify the source for thumbnail elements through the thumbnailSourceID property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.ShowPager
member.summary: Turns on or off the pager support in the Rotator control. The Pager is used to navigate the Rotator Items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.ShowCaption
member.summary: If the Rotator Item is an image, you can specify a caption for the Rotator Item. The caption text for each Rotator Item must be set by using the title attribute of the respective tag. The caption cannot be displayed if multiple Rotator Items are present.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.AllowKeyboardNavigation
member.summary: Turns on keyboard interaction with the Rotator items. You must set this property to true to access the following keyboard shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.EnableRTL
member.summary: Specifies right to left transition of slides.

member.summary: Enables the touch mode item rotation

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RotatorProperties.StopOnHover
member.summary: Pause the auto play while hover on the rotator content.

member.summary: Specifies the animation behavior of the rotator.

member.summary: Enables the circular mode item rotation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RTEproperties.ToolsList
member.summary: Specifies the list of groups and order of those groups displayed in the RTE toolbar. The toolsList property is used to get the root group order and tools property is used to get the inner order of the corresponding groups displayed. When the value is not specified, it gets its default display order and tools.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.RTEproperties.Tools
member.summary: Sets the tools in the RTE and gets the inner display order of the corresponding group element. Tools are dependent on the toolsList property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.JavaScript.RTEpropertiesBuilder.ToolsList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Specifies the list of groups and order of those groups displayed in the RTE toolbar. The toolsList property is used to get the root group order and tools property is used to get the inner order of the corresponding groups displayed. When the value is not specified, it gets its default display order and tools.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.EnableAltRow
member.summary: Specifies whether to render alternate rows in different background colors.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .EnableAltRow(true))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.AllowColumnResize
member.summary: Enables or disables the ability to resize the column width interactively.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .AllowColumnResize(false))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.AllowColumnReordering
member.summary: Enables or disables the ability to reorder the column position interactively.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .AllowColumnReordering(false))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Enables or disables the ability to filter the data on all the columns. Enabling this property will display a row with editor controls corresponding to each column. You can restrict filtering on particular column by disabling this property directly on that column instance itself.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .AllowFiltering(false))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Enables or disables the ability to drag and drop the row interactively to reorder the rows.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .AllowDragAndDrop(false))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: Specifies whether to render only the visual elements that are visible in the UI. When you enable this property, it will reduce the loading time for loading large number of records.

example.code: [@(Html.EJ().TreeGrid("TreeGridContainer") .EnableVirtualization(false))]

member.name: P:Syncfusion.JavaScript.Models.TreeGridProperties.AllowSorting
